Start: ^When I step into the garden, I notice that Timothy is here absentmindedly playing with the grass.

s0: ^I was looking to be alone, but I can't help noticing he looks especially bored.
s1: ^This must be... what was it, basketball?

s0: ^I'm deliberating whether or not to approach him when he looks up.
s1: ^The memories of before are hazy, as if recalling a dream.
^Timothy must have snuck up on me while I had my head in the clouds.

Start: ^] "Usually when people say that they're just being polite."
^[Timothy] "Yeah, but I really wasn't doing anything."
^] "I used to do nothing a lot. I understand."
^] "You should really try and look busy at least."

s0: ^As if on cue, Max appears, seemingly from out of nowhere.
s1: ^Knowing Max is around, I look to see where they popped up from last time. Oh, they slipped out of the Art Room door!

Start: ^Max lobs a large ball at my chest. My hands
^[Max] "I didn't throw it too hard, did I?"
^[Max] "Good. Anyway, I couldn't help but notice you guys lookin' bored out here, so I brought a suggestion."
^[Max] "Bingo! Or, wait... what's something you say in basketball? Score?"

s0: ^I can't think of a victory phrase associated with the game. More... loud noises.

b: ^Max shakes their head and turns to point behind the fence.
^[Max] "Well, technically it's not a full court. We've only got one basket, but there's not much call for a tournament-regulation setup."
^Sure enough, I can see the hoop affixed to the building behind the library.
^[Max] "I figured people didn't use it because a lot of our residents tend not to be athletic types, but if you didn't even know we had one maybe I should include it in the tour..."
^[Max] "Fair enough, but think of it this way: You've only got a handful of days left with easy access to a basketball court, right?"
^[Max] "Oh, neat! I always wanted to play tennis. It seems like something I would be good at..."

Start: ^[Max] "Anyways, it's a nice day out! Why not play some b-ball?"

c: ^[Max] "Awesome. I'll catch you guys later, then! Have fun and don't forget to stay hydrated!"
^I wave goodbye to Max and walk over to the court with Timothy.

Ballin: ^When we reach the court I practice dribbling the ball around a little.

s0: ^It's been a long time since I last played basketball.
s1: ^I feel slightly less rusty this time, but by no means comfortable.

s0: ^Actually, it's been a long time since I played any sport at all.
s1: ^I haven't really been the most physical person for the last six years.

Ballin: ^The concrete half-court has a few weeds growing out of the cracks, but is otherwise in good condition considering it never gets used.
^] "You seemed kinda hesitant before. You sure you want to do this?"
^[Timothy] "I do! I mean, it sounds fun... I just... I don't a-actually know how."
^] "I played a bit as a kid. My dad kinda forced me, really, but I had fun anyway."
^That was so long ago. I feel like a completely different person now.
^] "Well, you've got two teams, right? Pretty standard. Usually you have two baskets, too, and each time tries to get the ball in the other team's hoop."

b: ^] "And the game is played over... some amount of time, broken into... was it quarters? Oh, man, I don't actually remember any of the specifics."
^"Also, you have to keep moving or else you have to stop. And you can't carry the ball, you have to bounce it on the ground."
^"Oh, and if you do stop, you can pass the ball, but... well, we don't have any team members so I guess just don't?"
^"You know what, don't worry about all that. I know a much simpler way to play."
^I recall how my attempts to describe the full rules of the game went last time. It's probably better to just cut to the simple rules.
^] "But... rather that worry you with all the complicated stuff, I think we should play a simpler variant of the game."
^"It'll work a lot better since it's just the two of us, anyway."

Ballin: ^] "It's called HORSE. We take turns trying to get the ball in the basket. When one of us does, the other has to try to make it in from the same place."
^] "If that person fails, then it becomes their turn and they get a letter. H, then O, and so on until they have the whole word. If that happens, they lose."
^] "If they succeed, though, the person who made the original shot gets to go again."
^] "There's something else, too. When you go to make a basket, you can make a called shot. Like `backboard` or `swish`..."
^[Timothy] "So then the other person has to do that, too?"
^] "Assuming they do it, yeah. You have to match your boast. If I say I'm gonna `swish`, but the ball hits the rim, it doesn't count... even if it goes in."
^[Timothy] "I don't know if I can even make it in at all..."
^] "That's okay. How about we play a shorter version? We can do a three-letter word instead."

c: ^] "PIG? I think that's the most common choice for shorter games."
^] "RAT? Rats don't usually get a lotta love."

g-0: ^I gently bounce-pass the ball to Timothy.
^[Timothy] "Okay. I just have to throw it in, right?"

b: ^[Voices] "You call that a throw? What a failure."
^] "You win this round, yeah. But not the game. I've only got one letter:
^[Timothy] "Hey, now you've got a letter, too!"
^Now we're even!-else:Looks like you're making a comeback!
^[Voices] "You can't even beat a guy who's never held a basketball before. Disgraceful."
^] "We're both one away. I guess that means we're in sudden death."
^He moves to get the ball, but stops himself and turns back to me.
^[Timothy] "Would it... I-I hate to ask, but would it be awful if we stopped playing now?"
^] "We're nearing the end of the game, man."
^[Timothy] "I know! I mean... it's dumb, but I don't think I can win and I'm getting pretty tired."

c: ^] "Timothy, you can do this! And even if you don't, it's not like there's anything riding on this game. We're just two roommates passing a ball around!"

TimWon: ^] "You actually did. I told you you could do it."

b: ^[Voices] "This was never going to go any other way. Anyone could beat a worm like you."

Conclusion: ^Timothy turns and leaves, leaving the ball to slowly roll toward the edge of the building.
^I had fun, but I didn't really get to talk to Timothy one on one. Maybe I should have stopped the game when he asked...
^Nothing can be done about it now. I should get going as well.

Break: ^] "Sure, Timothy. It makes no difference to me."
^] "I can't believe I never noticed this was here..."
^] "Yeah, but you've got an excuse. I've been here almost a year."
^[Timothy] "Really? I-I thought people only stayed at places like this for a few months at most."
^] "Some do, but like I said on your first day: there's no time limit except what's recommended by your doctor or whoever."
^I remember Max explaining that Sunflower House moves slower than other places, but not why.
^"B-but my parents definitely want me home earlier than a year."
^] "Well, I hope you feel ready by then. But if not, that's fine, too."
^[Timothy] "Hey, thanks again for agreeing to take a break..."
^[Timothy] "You don't make a big deal out of anything,
^[Timothy] "<jitter>Oh! Oh no! I didn't mean! I-</jitter>"
^"I just mean that you're so cool, you know? Like... nothing bothers you."
^"You've got it together. You're leaving in less than a week and you know everybody and you're so laid back, meanwhile I can't even make it through a basketball game without..."
^Timothy falls quiet and starts fiddling with his shoelaces.
^ anyone's said about me in a while."
^"But I'm not as great as you think I am: certainly not any better than you."
^Timothy looks up bearing a confused expression.
^] "Yeah, well... being ready to move on doesn't mean you're better than those you leave behind."
^"Oh god, I sound like a fortune cookie."
^The two of us share a comfortable silence for a few minutes, before Timothy finally speaks up.
^[Timothy] "I'm getting hungry, so I'm off to get something to eat. It was nice hanging out with you,
^Timothy rises, smiles, and strides off at a relaxed pace.
^I think Timothy will feel more comfortable here after our conversation.
^I rest for a few more minutes, thinking about what Timothy said about me being "laid back."

s0: ^I've never thought of that as a strength before.
s1: ^It's funny how subjective these things are. I always got criticized for not being passionate enough.
